meanings.definition: In a way that is not wanted or wished for.
meanings.sent1: The rainy weather made the picnic area undesirably wet.
meanings.sent2: She found the taste of the medicine undesirably bitter.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided that the new brand of food was undesirably bland.
meanings.sent4: The movie theater was undesirably empty on a Friday night.
meanings.sent5: The traffic jam made the commute home undesirably long.

meanings.definition: In a manner that is not pleasing or attractive.
meanings.sent1: The old painting had faded undesirably over time.
meanings.sent2: The loud music was undesirably disruptive during the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The cake turned out undesirably lopsided after baking.
meanings.sent4: The once beautiful garden had become undesirably overgrown.
meanings.sent5: The new haircut looked undesirably uneven.
